titles.title: To repeal the authorization of transitional appropriations for the United States Postal Service, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Government Reform. H. Rept. 104-174.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 85.

bill.summary: 6/13/1995--Introduced. Repeals provisions of Federal law authorizing appropriations to the Postal Service Fund (Fund) to insure a sound financial transition for the Postal Service and a consistent rate policy. Provides that liabilities of the former Post Office Department to the Employees' Compensation Fund shall be liabilities of the Postal Service payable out of the Fund.
